overview: The journalist and presenter of ERT3, Christina Siganidou, uses as a title a phrase that became a slogan in the mouths of a large group of citizens of Thessaloniki and follows the course of the protests against a controversial decision for the city's Metro.  The lens follows the work of the Citizens' Movement of Thessaloniki and their struggle to prevent the government's decision to detach and dismember the antiquities that were excavated at the Venizelos station, during the metro works. It covers the 15 months from the birth of the Movement to Christmas 2020. In addition to amateur videos, which selectively capture this entire period, the filming took place during the second lockdown and imposed different filming conditions and the use of material from online interviews or online House meetings.
title: Crime at Venizelos Station
